Fix erroneously recording stats for spectator mode

If stats recording for spectator mode games is disabled and an active deck
is selected after spectating a gane (e.g. by starting an arena game), the
spectated game is assigned to the active deck because the end of a 0 turn
game is detected erroneously. This commit prevents the detection of a 0
turn game while in menu.

Set HasOutstandingTagChanges on first creation tag

Revealing previously revealed entities (e.g. discarded
from deck after mulligan) only prints already set tags/values.
This causes no actions to be enqueued (no actual tagchanges),
and therefore HasOutstandingTagChanges never to be set to false.

Setting it only after the first *actual* creation tag ensures there
is at least one enqueued action.

Fixes #3305

Refactor OptionsSearch ahead of supporting more option types

Instead of hard-coding `CheckBox` as the type of option to search for, use a
base class `OptionWrapper<T>`. Currently `CheckBoxWrapper` is the only concrete
child class, but more will be added for #3344.

Use a filter delegate to check whether an element is an "option" so we can
explicitly filter for `CheckBox` types, and for `DockPanel`s that contain a
`CheckBox`. In the future, `DockPanel`s that contain other types of controls
will also be selected. Finding the `DockPanel`s will let us find the related
text depending on the control type, as non-CheckBox types tend to have more
complicated UI.

This change should not affect search results today.

Update LoginWindow.xaml

When I attempted to build this project on windows 10 I got the error:

System.Windows.Markup.XamlParseException: Provide value on 'System.Windows.Baml2006.TypeConverterMarkupExtension' threw an exception. ---> System.IO.IOException: Cannot locate resource 'windows/images/hearthstonedecktracker.ico'.

Changing line 15 in MainWindow.xaml and line 7 in LoginWindow.xaml to:
Icon="/HearthstoneDeckTracker;component/Images/HearthstoneDeckTracker.ico"
will fix this issue

Update MainWindow.xaml

When I attempted to build this project on windows 10 I got the error:

System.Windows.Markup.XamlParseException: Provide value on 'System.Windows.Baml2006.TypeConverterMarkupExtension' threw an exception. ---> System.IO.IOException: Cannot locate resource 'windows/images/hearthstonedecktracker.ico'.

Changing line 15 in MainWindow.xaml and line 7 in LoginWindow.xaml to:
Icon="/HearthstoneDeckTracker;component/Images/HearthstoneDeckTracker.ico"
will fix this issue

Add China region constant

The constant 5 is used for China region. Without it we may
get an error when serializing DeckStat to disk:

  Instance validation error: '5' is not a valid value for
  Hearthstone_Deck_Tracker.Enums.Region.

Minor inconvenience when exporting to brawl, cannot change deck name. Unable to auto-detect brawl deck manager, so workaround by skipping SetDeckName if Deck is tagged with "brawl".

"Brawl" game mode added where necessary. Detection use asset unloading of "Tavern_Brawl" assets, seems to work reliably enough.

Archive decks feature

Add menu items to archive and unarchive decks.

Archived decks will not be visible in the deck picker under 'All' or
the deck's class. They will only be shown under the 'Archived' class
until they are unarchived. The archived class is not shown unless
there is at least one archived deck. Achived decks are marked with
an icon on the deck picker.

Archived decks are automatically unarchived after you edit them or
play a game with them (after a recorded game is assigned to the deck).

Change when Mana Curve (New Deck) gets Updated

Previously, the Mana Curve was being updated every time dbListView were being updated.
Thus, on every keypress in the card search the Mana Curve was also being updated resulting in slower card search performance.

Add config file version tracking

We save a CreatedByVersion string in the config file. With this in
place, we can determine which version of the application wrote the
config file when we load it. This allows us to change the semantics
of config variables in the future and have a mechanism for handling
it without breaking users' legacy config files. We are able to
interpret and update users' legacy config files to current semantics.

If the version doesn't exist in the config file, we assume it was
created prior to this commit.

With this in place, we can remove the hacky handing of when default
window positions were being stored as -32000. We no longer need to
handle this as a special case with the new multi-screen support.
See changes to OpponentWindow.xaml.cs, PlayerWindow.xaml.cs, and
'TimerWindow.xaml.cs'.
Fix typo

Fix saving window positions with multiple screens

With a multi-screen setup, pixel coordinates are expressed relative to
the top left of the system's default screen. This means that, with two
screens where the default is on the right, the x-coordinates of the
pixels on the left screen are expressed as negative integers. So we
cannot assume that valid window positions are only zero or positive.

Negative positions were being used to represent 'no specific position'
as a default. That means that when the windows are created for the
first time, we let the operating system decide where to place them.

As we should not be using negative positions for this purpose, since
they are in fact a valid range of pixel positions, use nullable types
instead. The default 'no specific position' is now expressed when the
positions are null.

Unfortunately, we still need to handle the special case where the
window position is stored as -32000 in the config file. This was
the previous default position for non-main windows (timer window,
opponent window, and player window). If the user has already used
the previous version of this application, but has not yet opened
a non-main window, they will have -32000 stored in the config file.

We obviously do not want to just blindly use this otherwise valid
value as it will position the windows far off the screen for most
users. This is a bit of a hacky solution, but without config file
versioning, or telling users to recreate their config files if they
experience the issue, we don't have any other way around this.

GetClientRect

GetClientRect returns the co-ordinates of a window's client area - ie. the area of a window minus the title bar and the window's borders.

GetWindowRect returns co-ordinates indicating the area of the whole window, title bar and border included/

This will provide for:-
a more accurate/simpler auto-clicker in DeckExporter
accurate positioning of overlays

This also eliminates the need for both fullscreen and windowed variables in config.xml for the co-ordinates of controls in Hearthstone.
